title: 110_hr2713
content: The Act titled the "Joseph H. Seall Act of 2007" waives the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits for terminally ill beneficiaries. The "Joseph H. Seall Act of 2007" allows the Commissioner of Social Security to waive the waiting period for disability insurance benefits for terminally ill individuals, based on established criteria. The "Joseph H. Seall Act of 2007" allows the Commissioner of Social Security to waive the waiting period for disability insurance benefits for terminally ill individuals. Additionally, widow's insurance benefits based on disability can also have the waiting period waived under certain circumstances. The "Joseph H. Seall Act of 2007" permits the Commissioner of Social Security to waive the waiting period for disability insurance benefits for terminally ill individuals, including widow's insurance benefits based on disability, if it would cause undue hardship. The Commissioner of Social Security can waive the waiting period for widower's insurance benefits if the individual is terminally ill and it would cause undue hardship. The Commissioner of Social Security can waive the waiting period for widower's insurance benefits if the individual is terminally ill with a life expectancy of 6 months or less. Amendments are made to the commencement of the period of disability under Section 216(i)(2)(A) of the Act. The Commissioner of Social Security may waive the five-month waiting period for disability benefits if the individual is terminally ill with a life expectancy of 6 months or less. The amendments made by the Act apply to benefits under the Social Security Act for individuals with a life expectancy of 6 months or less. Effective dates for the amendments vary depending on the specific benefits and disability determinations. SEC. 3. STUDY REGARDING DISABILITY CLAIMS PROCESSING. The Commissioner of Social Security will conduct a study on processing disability insurance claims under the Social Security Act, including methods used by State agencies and the Social Security Administration. The Commissioner of Social Security will compare methods and procedures for processing disability insurance claims under the Social Security Act with those used by other agencies and providers. A report with recommendations for improvements is due to the House Ways and Means Committee and the Senate Finance Committee within 120 days of the Act's enactment. The Commissioner of Social Security will compare disability determination processes to address the backlog in claims processing. Recommendations for legislative changes will be provided to improve efficiency.
